issue.subject: Switch all the libraries from the backend into frontend
issue.description:
Some users of easySDI want to securize backend access (/administrator) to only certain IP address.
Today it's not possible because all the common libraries (gxp, openlayers etc...) are stored in the backend.

The work that we have to do is to transfer all the libraries from :
- administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries
- administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries
- administrator/components/com_easysdi_dashboard/libraries
- administrator/components/com_easysdi_service/libraries

to a single : 
- administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries

and find and replace all paths in the code

journals.notes:
+1 for me ! Very good idea, many joomla users does that.

But be careful : we may have other calls from frontend :
* posts on backend
* ajax calls
* php proxies
* assets (images, css)
* ...

What I did : 

Move to front : 
administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries
- filesaver
- proj4js-1.1.0
- DataTables-1.9.4
- OpenLayers-2.13.1
- ext
- gemetclient-2.0.0
- geoext
- gxp
- jQuery-File-Upload-9.9.3
- leaflet
- syntaxhighlihter
- tablednd
- ux
- easysdi/catalog/addToBasket.js
- easysdi/catalog/bootbox.min.js
- easysdi/catalog/editMetadata.js
- easysdi/catalog/searchMetadata.js
- easysdi/js/*.*
- easysdi/view/view.js

administrator/components/com_easysdi_processing/assets/js/params_editors.js
administrator/components/com_easysdi_catalog/assets/css/easysdi_catalog.css
administrator/components/com_easysdi_catalog/assets/images/*.*
administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/assets/css/easysdi_loader.css

Move from components/com_easysdi_dashboard/libraries/flot-0.8.3 to components/com_easysdi_core/libraries/flot-0.8.3

Deleted folders :
administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries/proj4js-1.4.1
administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries/proxy
administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries/openlayers
administrator/components/com_easysdi_monitor/libraries/ext
administrator/components/com_easysdi_service/libraries
